emptyState.mainTitleWithPlans: It looks like this account doesn't have any storage configured for call recording yet.
emptyState.mainTitleNoPlans: You don't have any connector configured on your account.
emptyState.subTitleWithPlans: There are {{variable}} storage options detected on your account, please select one to store recordings.
emptyState.subTitleNoPlans: You need to enable Integrations app (like AWS Connector or Google Drive Connector) in order to use the Call-Recording app.

storageSettings.confirmChange: Changing storage options will reset all your current fodler configurations for storing saved call recordings. If you choose to continue, you will have to reconfigure all the storage folders for call recording on this account.
storageSettings.confirmDeleteText: This will remove the Call-Recording settings from this account.
storageSettings.successUpdate: Your Call-Recording Storage Settings were successfully updated!
storageSettings.successPathUpdate: You successfully updated the path where call-recordings will be stored.

endpoint.title: Force Record all Users on Account
endpoint.subTitle: Settings Forced Recording for users at the account level will cascade down to devices that are set to inherit any user's configuration that the device is attached to.

account.title: Force Record Entire Account
account.subTitle: Settings Forced Call-Recording for an entire account will record every call on the account, including callflows, ring groups, conferences, etc...

metaflow.title: On-demand (In-Call) Recording
metaflow.subTitle: This enables On-Demand (In-Call) Call Recording for all objects under this account

code.title: Feature Code
code.tooltip: This parameter lets you configure which sequence to input to enable Call-Recording while you're on a call.

metaflow.codeAlreadyExist: This number is not available as it's already used by another system feature.
